name: Pikachu
fact: Pikachu stores electricity in its cheeks and can release it through its electric attacks.

name: Raichu
fact: Raichu can generate powerful electric shocks and is known for its agility and speed.

name: Magnemite
fact: Magnemite is a Steel/Electric-type Pokémon that uses electromagnetic fields to levitate.

name: Magneton
fact: Magneton is formed by three Magnemite sticking together and can create powerful magnetic fields.

name: Electrode
fact: Electrode is known for its ability to self-destruct, releasing a powerful electric blast.

name: Voltorb
fact: Voltorb is often mistaken for a Poké Ball due to its similar shape and coloration.

name: Electabuzz
fact: Electabuzz generates electricity through friction, which it can release during battle.

name: Electivire
fact: Electivire can generate a massive amount of electricity, which it uses to enhance its physical attacks.

name: Jolteon
fact: Jolteon’s fur can generate electric currents that it releases through its sharp quills.

name: Pachirisu
fact: Pachirisu stores electricity in its cheek pouches, which it can release in a powerful electric burst.

name: Plusle
fact: Plusle is known for its ability to generate electricity when it works together with Minun.

name: Minun
fact: Minun is a companion to Plusle and works together with it to generate electricity.

name: Zeraora
fact: Zeraora is known for its speed and agility, able to discharge electric shocks from its claws.
